doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: JG 18051820s; alteration: late 19th century; alteration: 1949; alteration: mid 1997

Mint Meadows--Allegedly face of Eliz Garth etched by lightning in a window pane--Parts from house were stored in Tack Room on the property--Jefferson had given him a violin--1853 Benjamin Wood Home--1855 Charles H Price Home--1863 Abr Updike Home--1880 Robert E Thomas Home

1 Story Brick Hall-Parlor then raised to I-House w/2 Story Brick gable end Addition with new gable roof over all with Center Gable, 3 Bay evolved into 6 Bay, Cyma Recta Molded Brick Cornice painted white, Flemish Bond, 3 Course American Bond, Penciling, Brick Cellar Floors, Bulkhead, Mortise and Tenon Joinery, Pegged Joinery, No Ridge Board, Rivens with Cut Nails with Stamped Heads, Reciprocating Saw Marks, Graining, Marbleizing, Pedestal Chair Rails, Transoms, 6 Panel Doors, 4 Panel Door, Diagonally Set Wood Horizontal Cellar Bars, 9/9, 6/6, Blinds, Verandah, Stone Lined Ice Pit, Well, Cemeteries, Slave Cemetery
